text:
Ability to collect properties into one TASK/reference to load into Java. Most 
Java programs require command line options/arguments. So I was thinking Ant 
would be a good way to bring order into the way arguments are passed. By 
Collecting properties into property groups and being able to feed these 
property groups as arguments, the problem could be solved?
creator: wenkirao@yahoo.com
bodewig@apache.org
text:
Pick up a recent nightly build.  It contains a new data-type named <propertyset>
and <java> supports a nested <syspropertyset> that can take a reference to an
existing set.

creator: maheswarkunu@gmail.com
text:
HI Team,

In our environment, We are trying to access one report residing on server C from server A through server B. server B has proxy.

we are encountering intermittent error during this.
the error we see on server -B, ssl error log as below:

[Mon May 26 22:21:40 2014] [error] (20014)Error string not specified yet: proxy: pass request body failed to host-c:443 (host-c)
[Mon May 26 22:21:40 2014] [error] (20014)Error string not specified yet: proxy: pass request body failed to host-c:443 (host-c) from host-a ()

Could you please help to advise on this error.

Thanks.

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
Why did you hijack a resolved Apache Ant bug from 2003?

If you want advice, try a mailing list.
